name: seed-cotton production, conventional | seed-cotton | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22031/documentation

This inventory dataset exclusively covers the field activity for the production of 1kg seed-cotton in the Gujarat state in India in 2016-17. ;Total yield is 1'750 kg/ha. The production of seed cotton involved inputs of land tillage (ridge tillage), irrigation, seeds, mineral fertilizers (urea, ammonium phosphate), pesticides and compost. ;Cotton requires 6 to 8 months to mature. Its time of sowing and harvesting differs in different parts of the country depending upon the climatic conditions. In Punjab and Haryana it is sown in April-May and is harvested in December-January that is before the winter frost can damage the crop. In the peninsular part of India, it is sown upto October and harvested between January and May because there is no danger of winter frost in these areas. Cotton quickly exhausts the fertility of soil, therefore, regular application of manures and fertilizers to the soils is very necessary.;The seed cotton activity culminates in the harvesting of seed cotton from the field. Since picking of cotton is not yet mechanized, and mostly done manually. Normally the picking season is spread over a period of about three months. Cotton plants demand water during the active growth phase and dry weather is need at the maturity as the cotton boll opens. About one-third of the total area under cotton cultivation is irrigated. In this dataset, the amount of irrigation needed is included and the irrigation process is covered in a different dataset. The activity for this dataset ends here right after the harvesting operation. ;;

The activity starts after the harvest of the previous crop and receipt of the inputs of seeds, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, and irrigation water at the field. Machinery and fixed overhead are excluded.

The activity ends at the harvesting of seed-cotton in the field.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0116:Growing of fibre crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The data were collected for 2015-2016 cropping season. The same cultivation practice has been practised over the last couple of decades with increased mechanization in tillage and irrigation. In the near future, the scope of changes in the current cultivation paradigm is low. It means that the dataset will remain valid for the next decade or so.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data has been collected from state of Gujarat in India
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data has been generated in Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Primary data from farmers. Standardized questionnaires were developed and adapted to cotton-specific cultivation and post-harvest situation. The secondary data from literature and the primary data from surveys were compared and matched to obtain the highest data quality

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of seed-cotton is calculated to be circa 4.63E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'cyclic N-compound', 'pesticide, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 9.27E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'seed-cotton' is calculated to be circa 1.84E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.68E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
